p: As depicted in Figure 14, [N 1444]Cl exhibits the electrochemical window of 2.8 V with the cation reduction potential of âˆ’1.9 V and the anion oxidation potential of +0.9 V. The use of [N 1444]Cl as electrolyte for the UO 2 2+/UO 2 reduction couple allowed a fast (40 min) deposit of a considerable amount of uranium in the form of uranium dioxide.
